by_statement: New Line Cinema presents a Wingnut Films production ; producers, Barrie M. Osborne ... [et al.] ; screenplay writers, Fran Walsh ... [et al.] ; director, Peter Jackson
other_titles: Les seigneur des anneaux, La communauté de l'anneau

description.value: Elderly hobbit Bilbo Baggins relinquishes possession of a golden ring possessing magical powers to Frodo, his youthful heir. Charged with casting the ring into the fires from which it was forged, the young hobbit begins an arduous trek across Middle-earth, accompanied by a stalwart band including his best friend Sam, the cercurial wizard Gandalf, the warrior Aragorn, and the blustery Gimli, among others. Opposed by the treacherous sorcerer Saruman and the demonic emissaries of Sauron, the Dark Lord, this ever-embattled Fellowship makes its way slowly toward the dark land of Mordor.

subtitle: notes
title: Lord of the Rings, The hobbit

table_of_contents.value: Introduction: The primacy of preaching in Protestant worship
Be hearers of the Word and not doers only
The minister as parson, preacher, and pastor
"Compel them to come in" : the Gospel as divine command, not consumer choice
The world's heroes and the church's saints
A call for a latter-day reformation of the church
Wrestling Jacob and being named by God
The no-people who have become God's people
The suffering that makes for character
Christians as the little ones, the hobbits of the world
A farewell sermon to a faithful people
The rock that springs with the water of life
Christians and Jews : wayfarers through the wasteland
Loud, dogmatic, and certain : good Christian words
Thou shalt not slay bodies or souls
Waiting, watching, and enduring the end
Jesus as both Savior and Lord
Hosanna to the King who rides upon a donkey
The call of the cross and the table
The vocations of ministry and marriage
A fiery red-head called to the ministry
A marriage built on the solid rock
A man of godly fear and suffering obedience
Feasting on manna and turnip greens
A woman whose name and life sparkled
A woman who waited for the Lord God
A fearless and funny preacher of the Gospel.

description.value: Bilbo Baggins, a respectable, well-to-do hobbit, lives comfortably in his hobbit-hole until the day the wandering wizard Gandalf chooses him to take part in an adventure from which he may never return.

A parody of The hobbit, taking great liberties so that it becomes a spoof of fairy tales.  A Wimp sets off against his will on a quest  for a dragon's gold along with some pixies and a meddling magician.  S & M spiders, hillbilly gremlins, an Imp Princess who changes clothes every fifteen minutes, etc.
